Music in champ select can't be turned off in champ select. Wtf.
This is a huge pet peeve of mine too. It makes me cry when the music plays over my team strategizing on skype.

If you are using Windows, you can click the volume adjust icon in the bottom right corner, then click "Mixer." This opens a menu in which you can adjust the volume for each program individually. Then, just mute "PVP.net client." Don't worry, when your game starts, its sound will still be there!
Why does everyone hate Master Yi mid?

Because the lack of ranged pressure plus his extremely hit or miss snowball style means that you are leaving your team without  AoE CC (a common mid trait) at very high risk of being countered (armor) with very minimal gank potential, unless your team compensated by playing CC jungle (tanks - not popular in current meta) or double support (also not popular).

After looking for work, among game companies and normal software ones, I finally got a job! My dream is to become a technical designer like you Xelnath, but it seems for starters I'll have to settle as a software engineer at least so I can move.

I looked for work for almost half a year, and after being turned down at several places, I was starting to lose spirit slightly. Apparently I made good impression on some recruiters though, because I got two job offers this same week. It was the greatest feeling I've had that is related to working. I was feeling wanted, they was fighting over who could hire me, and their fighting increased my monthly salary by about $300. Money is not important to me, I just wanna work with something I love, but the feeling of being wanted it was GREAT!

I will now pursue the game design and game developer in my spare time, me and a friend have a small game project we are gonna do either in unity or in his framework he have made. Being able to move, means we live in same town at least, and in the future I can maybe get a job at Paradox Arctic which is in same town as well. It feels as if I am moving slowly but surely towards my dreams!

Oh, wow. What happened?

I'm stuck...

I've been on a path in school for the last 3 years working towards getting into a position in the game design industry. I've also had a longtime love for making music since I discovered I had a talent for the ukelele in the 6th grade. I started to learn the violin but ended up stopping after 3-ish months (this was a year or so ago), even though I feel like I could have gone somewhere with it, just because I was too afraid to let people hear me practice. I've also started trying to teach myself the piano in the last couple weeks, after having the urge to do so for months, which is a little easier because I can use an electronic keyboard with headphones. Finally, I make EDM in FL studio, which is basically the only thing I've ever WANTED to put time into on the computer other than video games. 

With all that said, I've always wished I could make music a career path, whether it be through EDM, piano, violin, guitar, or anything... but I never genuinely considered it until I realized I would probably drop my pursuit of the game design industry in a heartbeat if it meant I could make music for a living :(

Now I'm stuck. It's too late to switch after all this time and money spent working on getting into this interactive arts and tech program, even though my real passion lies elsewhere. I get this sick feeling in my gut every time I think about where I might be if I had chosen to pursue music instead, how I could have been amazing at these instruments if I hadn't dropped them, and all these other missed opportunity things :(

It sounds to me like that a fundamental level... you're scared of being vulnerable and opening yourself up to being judged based on your craft - which is the very thing that defines your success. 

Here's a few thoughts....

#1) It's okay to put yourself out there
#2) It's okay to be wrong and need to correct things
#3) It's okay to be right and for people to disagree, dislike it or prefer something else. 

Now, this is very, very important:

This core issue is an  issue whether you are in music, game design, art, literature, computer science, robotics, biomedical waste removal, car repair or whatever else requires you to use your mind.  I highly recommend opening up about your fears to someone you consider a peer or rival and asking them to critique your work. 

Stop looking backwards and thinking about lost opportunities. A friend of mine constantly quotes Meteos on Skype and says: "Stop apologizing about what happened. Ask yourself what we do now to have a chance to win the game."

This is true of life too!  If you could do *anything* and not have to worry about money, what would it be? Do you know? Great. Pick that and shoot for it. 

If you love both music and game design... you might just be the next composer for a game like Transistor.  

That said... you just spent three paragraphs talking about your love of music and almost none of your favorite game mechanics. You might already know your answer.

You know, I don't have full context on what Marc was trying to say. Here's my interpretation. (I leave it to Jaredan and Tryndamere to disagree)

Removing summoners from their previous story role as god-like manipulators of champions inside of an arena doesn't mean beings that summon couldn't exist within the world of runeterra. It also means that summoners as a player group are a very real thing - you guys don't just disappear because we decided to change the story:game connection. 

But again, all personal interpretation.

I'd just like to say two things:

* Summoners weren't god-like manipulators, they were merging their minds with the champions.
* Summoners as a player group makes no sense to me if it isn't resembled in the game in any way, which it isn't?

But don't mind me, I'm just an old Trundle fan tired of arguing against the brick wall that the new lore department seems to be.

Hey Terra,

We've met in person before at least once at a convention or expo. I know that you know that extreme statements like that just create hostility and don't help the situation. 

I totally get it that you're frustrated by our history, but just look at how much Jaredan and his lore team have been trying to help recently. 

Having met you I know that you can be polite and considerate, while being passionate. Prove that here too :)

> Hey Terra,
> 
> We've met in person before at least once at a convention or expo. 

I'm glad you remembered! :D

>I know that you know that extreme statements like that just create hostility and don't help the situation. 

I'm not going to beat around the bush.  When my passions flare up, sometimes I go direct into hyperbole and extremities.   Still, while you are correct that they don't help, the fact remains that there is a disconnect between the Narrative team in charge of the story and the president of the company that team works for.  
 
> I totally get it that you're frustrated by our history, but just look at how much Jaredan and his lore team have been trying to help recently. 

Are the efforts of Jaredan and Carnival Knights appreciated?  Yes.  They're doing much more to communicate than the previous lore teams did, including the one that "debated" and announced the retcon and short bio changes before being replaced with the current team.  (Note:  *The word "debated" is in quotation marks since I wasn't there, there's no proof that a debate happened, and Narrative **lost the right** to expect my trust after three years of silence and forced changes, like the Freljord*.)
 
Is it enough?  I don't think it is.  There are still a metric ton of unanswered questions and the last meaningful conversation took place just before Worlds.  Also, two people out of an entire team of who knows how many members doesn't seem like much to me.

I mean, if I was put in charge of a team that had a history of not communicating with their most passionate fans, I would talk to them until they were sick of reading my posts, starting from the first moment I sat at my cubicle.  While I couldn't answer every question posed to me, I would at least acknowledge the problems.

Maybe that's just me, but that's the level of effort I feel would need to be shown, just to at least start repairing the bridge of trust the other Narrative/Lore teams destroyed over the past two years .

> Having met you I know that you can be polite and considerate, while being passionate. Prove that here too :)

I'll be honest.  When I try being polite and considerate about Lore or any other topic I care about, I haven't received many responses from Rioters.  Even then, those responses are more to the tune of "We hear you" and "Please trust us," or they include inappropriate movie quotes and dismissive statements.  It's getting repetitive, to be honest.

I wish I *could* be more polite and considerate, but Narrative isn't giving me much reason to be.

I can't speak for Terra, but as for me, I'm not even sure that anything I say will even matter. The president of the company himself said 'We won't please everyone, but we're sure that the old lore fans will like this eventually!'

That feels incredibly dismissive. Every time I write up some sort of post about my feelings on the old lore, trying to keep constructive and not devolve into angry rambling, I have a voice in the back of my head that's going 'You're wasting your time. It doesn't matter what you say, so don't censor yourself and say what you REALLY want to.' I have half finished essays on why this is bad thing for the story, without the motivation to finish them because I don't think it'd matter.

Riot's been pretty bad at official communication, lately. There's always a bunch of responses to 'can you play with me' and 'this is a good skin idea' and 'Rammus threads are still funny, right?', but not many for actual discussion. And I get that Worlds was on recently, but as someone who couldn't care less about professional play, that's not much of an excuse.  Even the only big discussion thread that's up feels like typing into a brick wall at times. Stashu's actually communicating, and that's great, but I feel like I've had this song and dance before, with the Sona rework. It worked out fine eventually, but 'eventually' is a long time to not be able to play your favorite champ.

(Incidentally, I'm looking at how much the lore team has been trying to help. The last post was six days ago, and they still haven't responded to any of the myriad 'What the hell is going on?' threads in any way besides the patented lore team'Be patient, we'll start on them eventually!' that we've been hearing for years. Honestly, I'm giving up on them, unless they suddenly get a Xelnath/IronStylus/Morello level communicator.)

> I totally get it that you're frustrated by our history, but just look at how much Jaredan and his lore team have been trying to help recently. 

Might I ask for some examples of how much Jaredan and the lore team have been trying to help recently? All I can think of is the Xerath thread?

Meanwhile I still have barely any arguments in favor of removing the IoW, I still have glaringly unpreserved identities over retcons and I'm still being told to just trust the lore department after my Trundle got blatantly replaced for a similar but definitely different character.

For all I know, the lore department is just producing their own product that is entirely unrelated to League of Legends and will be retconned again in a year. I can't invest in a lore of which I don't trust the writers, that'd be stupid, it'd just set me up to get hurt *again*.

I'm frustrated because I would expect better from Riot but I haven't gotten better in two years.

Please, please do. Reaching out for help is the healthiest way to handle this kind of situation.  When I was about 12 or 13, I went through a horrible depressive period.  I was unhappy. I was alone. I had few friends and the friends I had were constantly far away from me - or only connectable online. 

Thankfully, both my parents and I got counselling. It was... rough. Honestly, I had a great upbringing, but there were a lot of scars from previous experiences that were being transferring into trust issues in our family. I won't say it all got fixed, but bringing visibility back then helped me start looking at myself and how to grow. 

... it helps.

Rule #1) 

Having the same interests is not the same as having chemistry.  Chemistry is something you both choose to create - often founded on, but never exclusively based upon, common interests. 

Rule #2) 

Invite her to do something fun or casual with her. Don't pretend it isn't something though.  "Hey, I know you weren't expecting this, but I think you're cute and we should hang out. Interested in coffee thursday?"

Ideally, this should happen *after* having normal human being conversations. 

Then if she says no.... just drop it and move on. If she's not super enthusiastic then you don't want to be constantly trying to "wear her down" - that's no fun for her.  Think about what will make her life better. Having yet another dude constantly harassing her? Not better.

I'm not sure. I feel we have more problematic champs who need some love first. But Gangplank certainly needs some.

Do you think it would be possible, or reasonable to give Mini-Gnar 5 more range per level?

He would still start with the lowest AA range, but grow into a reasonable range faster, and fit more with his character by giving him a strong (but not best, like his movespeed) AA range at max level. Considering it's his Kiting skills that end strong and his Tank skills that stay weak, I'm not sure why his AA range was made to be so low through an entire game.

Basically it would improve his playability without damaging his matchups as he'd still start lowest and end higher.

Also, have you considered making Ryze's abilities blocked by creeps, in a similar way to Lulu's Pix, rather than cut his Mana damage? No more free harass and he'd still get to build in his unique way.

It would be a pretty substantial rework to make Ryze a skillshot character. That might scare off his current audience, too.

Do feel like we could make his fantasy of a rapid fire mage more fun that way, but considering the characters we still have yet to rework, I am pretty confident that there's more important champions to do first.
